verses.translation: Ta. Sin. Mim.
These are verses of the Book that makes (things) clear.

verses.arabic: لَعَلَّكَ بَـٰخِعٌ نَّفْسَكَ أَلَّا يَكُونُوا۟ مُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: It may be thou frettest thy soul with grief, that they do not become Believers.

verses.arabic: إِن نَّشَأْ نُنَزِّلْ عَلَيْهِم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ ءَايَةً فَظَلَّتْ أَعْنَـٰقُهُمْ لَهَا خَـٰضِعِينَ
verses.translation: If (such) were Our Will, We could send down to them from the sky a Sign, to which they would bend their necks in humility.
verses.transliteration: In nasha/ nunazzil AAalayhim mina assama-iayatan fathallat aAAnaquhum lahakhadiAAeen

verses.arabic: وَمَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن ذِكْرٍ مِّنَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ مُحْدَثٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا۟ عَنْهُ مُعْرِضِينَ
verses.translation: But there comes not to them a newly-revealed Message from (Allah) Most Gracious, but they turn away therefrom.
verses.transliteration: Wama ya/teehim min thikrin minaarrahmani muhdathin illa kanooAAanhu muAArideen

verses.arabic: فَقَدْ كَذَّبُوا۟ فَسَيَأْتِيهِمْ أَنۢبَـٰٓؤُا۟ مَا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ يَسْتَهْزِءُونَ
verses.translation: They have indeed rejected (the Message): so they will know soon (enough) the truth of what they mocked at!
verses.transliteration: Faqad kaththaboo fasaya/teehim anbaoma kanoo bihi yastahzi-oon

verses.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ إِلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ كَمْ أَنۢبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوْجٍ كَرِيمٍ
verses.translation: Do they not look at the earth,- how many noble things of all kinds We have produced therein?
verses.transliteration: Awa lam yaraw ila al-ardi kamanbatna feeha min kulli zawjin kareem

verses.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: Verily, in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.
verses.transliteration: Inna fee thalika laayatan wamakana aktharuhum mu/mineen

verses.translation: And verily, thy Lord is He, the Exalted in Might, Most Merciful.

verses.arabic: وَإِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبُّكَ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱئْتِ ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
verses.translation: Behold, thy Lord called Moses: "Go to the people of iniquity,-
verses.transliteration: Wa-ith nada rabbukamoosa ani i/ti alqawma aththalimeen

verses.translation: "The people of the Pharaoh: will they not fear Allah?"

verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ أَن يُكَذِّبُونِ
verses.translation: He said: "O my Lord! I do fear that they will charge me with falsehood:

verses.arabic: وَيَضِيقُ صَدْرِى وَلَا يَنطَلِقُ لِسَانِى فَأَرْسِلْ إِلَىٰ هَـٰرُونَ
verses.translation: "My breast will be straitened. And my speech may not go (smoothly): so send unto Aaron.
verses.transliteration: Wayadeequ sadree walayantaliqu lisanee faarsil ila haroon

verses.arabic: وَلَهُمْ عَلَىَّ ذَنۢبٌ فَأَخَافُ أَن يَقْتُلُونِ
verses.translation: "And (further), they have a charge of crime against me; and I fear they may slay me."

verses.arabic: قَالَ كَلَّا ۖ فَٱذْهَبَا بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَآ ۖ إِنَّا مَعَكُم مُّسْتَمِعُونَ
verses.translation: Allah said: "By no means! proceed then, both of you, with Our Signs; We are with you, and will listen (to your call).
verses.transliteration: Qala kalla fathhababi-ayatina inna maAAakum mustamiAAoon

verses.arabic: فَأْتِيَا فِرْعَوْنَ فَقُولَآ إِنَّا رَسُولُ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
verses.translation: "So go forth, both of you, to Pharaoh, and say: 'We have been sent by the Lord and Cherisher of the worlds;
verses.transliteration: Fa/tiya firAAawna faqoola innarasoolu rabbi alAAalameen

verses.translation: "'Send thou with us the Children of Israel.'"

verses.arabic: قَالَ أَلَمْ نُرَبِّكَ فِينَا وَلِيدًا وَلَبِثْتَ فِينَا مِنْ عُمُرِكَ سِنِينَ
verses.translation: (Pharaoh) said: "Did we not cherish thee as a child among us, and didst thou not stay in our midst many years of thy life?
verses.transliteration: Qala alam nurabbika feenawaleedan walabithta feena min AAumurika sineen

verses.arabic: وَفَعَلْتَ فَعْلَتَكَ ٱلَّتِى فَعَلْتَ وَأَنتَ مِنَ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
verses.translation: "And thou didst a deed of thine which (thou knowest) thou didst, and thou art an ungrateful (wretch)!"
verses.transliteration: WafaAAalta faAAlataka allatee faAAaltawaanta mina alkafireen

verses.arabic: قَالَ فَعَلْتُهَآ إِذًا وَأَنَا۠ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ
verses.translation: Moses said: "I did it then, when I was in error.

verses.arabic: فَفَرَرْتُ مِنكُمْ لَمَّا خِفْتُكُمْ فَوَهَبَ لِى رَبِّى حُكْمًا وَجَعَلَنِى مِنَ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.translation: "So I fled from you (all) when I feared you; but my Lord has (since) invested me with judgment (and wisdom) and appointed me as one of the messengers.
verses.transliteration: Fafarartu minkum lamma khiftukumfawahaba lee rabbee hukman wajaAAalanee mina almursaleen

verses.arabic: وَتِلْكَ نِعْمَةٌ تَمُنُّهَا عَلَىَّ أَنْ عَبَّدتَّ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ
verses.translation: "And this is the favour with which thou dost reproach me,- that thou hast enslaved the Children of Israel!"
verses.transliteration: Watilka niAAmatun tamunnuha AAalayyaan AAabbadta banee isra-eel

verses.translation: Pharaoh said: "And what is the 'Lord and Cherisher of the worlds'?"

verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَآ ۖ إِن كُنتُم مُّوقِنِينَ
verses.translation: (Moses) said: "The Lord and Cherisher of the heavens and the earth, and all between,- if ye want to be quite sure."
verses.transliteration: Qala rabbu assamawatiwal-ardi wama baynahuma in kuntummooqineen

verses.translation: (Pharaoh) said to those around: "Did ye not listen (to what he says)?"
(Moses) said: "Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers from the beginning!"

verses.arabic: قَالَ إِنَّ رَسُولَكُمُ ٱلَّذِىٓ أُرْسِلَ إِلَيْكُمْ لَمَجْنُونٌ
verses.translation: (Pharaoh) said: "Truly your messenger who has been sent to you is a veritable madman!"
verses.transliteration: Qala inna rasoolakumu allatheeorsila ilaykum lamajnoon

verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلْمَشْرِقِ وَٱلْمَغْرِبِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَآ ۖ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ
verses.translation: (Moses) said: "Lord of the East and the West, and all between! if ye only had sense!"
verses.transliteration: Qala rabbu almashriqi walmaghribiwama baynahuma in kuntum taAAqiloon

verses.arabic: قَالَ لَئِنِ ٱتَّخَذْتَ إِلَـٰهًا غَيْرِى لَأَجْعَلَنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلْمَسْجُونِينَ
verses.translation: (Pharaoh) said: "If thou dost put forward any god other than me, I will certainly put thee in prison!"
verses.transliteration: Qala la-ini ittakhathta ilahanghayree laajAAalannaka mina almasjooneen

verses.translation: (Moses) said: "Even if I showed you something clear (and) convincing?"
verses.transliteration: Qala awa law ji/tuka bishay-in mubeen

verses.arabic: قَالَ فَأْتِ بِهِۦٓ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
verses.translation: (Pharaoh) said: "Show it then, if thou tellest the truth!"
verses.transliteration: Qala fa/ti bihi in kunta mina assadiqeen

verses.arabic: فَأَلْقَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِىَ ثُعْبَانٌ مُّبِينٌ
verses.translation: So (Moses) threw his rod, and behold, it was a serpent, plain (for all to see)!

verses.arabic: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُۥ فَإِذَا هِىَ بَيْضَآءُ لِلنَّـٰظِرِينَ
verses.translation: And he drew out his hand, and behold, it was white to all beholders!

verses.arabic: قَالَ لِلْمَلَإِ حَوْلَهُۥٓ إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَسَـٰحِرٌ عَلِيمٌ
verses.translation: (Pharaoh) said to the Chiefs around him: "This is indeed a sorcerer well-versed:
verses.transliteration: Qala lilmala-i hawlahu inna hathalasahirun AAaleem

verses.arabic: يُرِيدُ أَن يُخْرِجَكُم مِّنْ أَرْضِكُم بِسِحْرِهِۦ فَمَاذَا تَأْمُرُونَ
verses.translation: "His plan is to get you out of your land by his sorcery; then what is it ye counsel?"
verses.transliteration: Yureedu an yukhrijakum min ardikumbisihrihi famatha ta/muroon

verses.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ أَرْجِهْ وَأَخَاهُ وَٱبْعَثْ فِى ٱلْمَدَآئِنِ حَـٰشِرِينَ
verses.translation: They said: "Keep him and his brother in suspense (for a while), and dispatch to the Cities heralds to collect-
verses.transliteration: Qaloo arjih waakhahu wabAAathfee almada-ini hashireen

verses.translation: "And bring up to thee all (our) sorcerers well-versed."
So the sorcerers were got together for the appointment of a day well-known,
And the people were told: "Are ye (now) assembled?-

verses.arabic: لَعَلَّنَا نَتَّبِعُ ٱلسَّحَرَةَ إِن كَانُوا۟ هُمُ ٱلْغَـٰلِبِينَ
verses.translation: "That we may follow the sorcerers (in religion) if they win?"
verses.transliteration: LaAAallana nattabiAAu assaharatain kanoo humu alghalibeen

verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ قَالُوا۟ لِفِرْعَوْنَ أَئِنَّ لَنَا لَأَجْرًا إِن كُنَّا نَحْنُ ٱلْغَـٰلِبِينَ
verses.translation: So when the sorcerers arrived, they said to Pharaoh: "Of course - shall we have a (suitable) reward if we win?
verses.transliteration: Falamma jaa assaharatuqaloo lifirAAawna a-inna lana laajran in kunnanahnu alghalibeen

verses.arabic: قَالَ نَعَمْ وَإِنَّكُمْ إِذًا لَّمِنَ ٱلْمُقَرَّبِينَ
verses.translation: He said: "Yea, (and more),- for ye shall in that case be (raised to posts) nearest (to my person)."

verses.arabic: قَالَ لَهُم مُّوسَىٰٓ أَلْقُوا۟ مَآ أَنتُم مُّلْقُونَ
verses.translation: Moses said to them: "Throw ye - that which ye are about to throw!"
verses.transliteration: Qala lahum moosa alqoo maantum mulqoon

verses.arabic: فَأَلْقَوْا۟ حِبَالَهُمْ وَعِصِيَّهُمْ وَقَالُوا۟ بِعِزَّةِ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّا لَنَحْنُ ٱلْغَـٰلِبُونَ
verses.translation: So they threw their ropes and their rods, and said: "By the might of Pharaoh, it is we who will certainly win!"
verses.transliteration: Faalqaw hibalahum waAAisiyyahumwaqaloo biAAizzati firAAawna inna lanahnualghaliboon

verses.arabic: فَأَلْقَىٰ مُوسَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِىَ تَلْقَفُ مَا يَأْفِكُونَ
verses.translation: Then Moses threw his rod, when, behold, it straightway swallows up all the falsehoods which they fake!
verses.transliteration: Faalqa moosa AAasahufa-itha hiya talqafu ma ya/fikoon

verses.translation: Then did the sorcerers fall down, prostrate in adoration,
Saying: "We believe in the Lord of the Worlds,
"The Lord of Moses and Aaron."

verses.arabic: قَالَ ءَامَنتُمْ لَهُۥ قَبْلَ أَنْ ءَاذَنَ لَكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ ٱلَّذِى عَلَّمَكُمُ ٱلسِّحْرَ فَلَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ ۚ لَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيْدِيَكُمْ وَأَرْجُلَكُم مِّنْ خِلَـٰفٍ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.translation: Said (Pharaoh): "Believe ye in Him before I give you permission? surely he is your leader, who has taught you sorcery! but soon shall ye know! Be sure I will cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will cause you all to die on the cross!"
verses.transliteration: Qala amantum lahu qabla an athanalakum innahu lakabeerukumu allathee AAallamakumu assihrafalasawfa taAAlamoona laoqattiAAanna aydiyakum waarjulakummin khilafin walaosallibannakum ajmaAAeen

verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ لَا ضَيْرَ ۖ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا مُنقَلِبُونَ
verses.translation: They said: "No matter! for us, we shall but return to our Lord!
verses.transliteration: Qaloo la dayra innaila rabbina munqaliboon

verses.arabic: إِنَّا نَطْمَعُ أَن يَغْفِرَ لَنَا رَبُّنَا خَطَـٰيَـٰنَآ أَن كُنَّآ أَوَّلَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: "Only, our desire is that our Lord will forgive us our faults, that we may become foremost among the believers!"
verses.transliteration: Inna natmaAAu an yaghfira lanarabbuna khatayana an kunnaawwala almu/mineen

verses.arabic: ۞ وَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنْ أَسْرِ بِعِبَادِىٓ إِنَّكُم مُّتَّبَعُونَ
verses.translation: By inspiration we told Moses: "Travel by night with my servants; for surely ye shall be pursued."
verses.transliteration: Waawhayna ila moosaan asri biAAibadee innakum muttabaAAoon

verses.translation: Then Pharaoh sent heralds to (all) the Cities,
(Saying): "These (Israelites) are but a small band,
"And they are raging furiously against us;
"But we are a multitude amply fore-warned."
So We expelled them from gardens, springs,
Treasures, and every kind of honourable position;
Thus it was, but We made the Children of Israel inheritors of such things.
So they pursued them at sunrise.

verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا تَرَٰٓءَا ٱلْجَمْعَانِ قَالَ أَصْحَـٰبُ مُوسَىٰٓ إِنَّا لَمُدْرَكُونَ
verses.translation: And when the two bodies saw each other, the people of Moses said: "We are sure to be overtaken."
verses.transliteration: Falamma taraa aljamAAaniqala as-habu moosa innalamudrakoon

verses.arabic: قَالَ كَلَّآ ۖ إِنَّ مَعِىَ رَبِّى سَيَهْدِينِ
verses.translation: (Moses) said: "By no means! my Lord is with me! Soon will He guide me!"

verses.arabic: فَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱضْرِب بِّعَصَاكَ ٱلْبَحْرَ ۖ فَٱنفَلَقَ فَكَانَ كُلُّ فِرْقٍ كَٱلطَّوْدِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
verses.translation: Then We told Moses by inspiration: "Strike the sea with thy rod." So it divided, and each separate part became like the huge, firm mass of a mountain.
verses.transliteration: Faawhayna ila moosaani idrib biAAasaka albahra fanfalaqafakana kullu firqin kattawdi alAAatheem

verses.translation: And We made the other party approach thither.
We delivered Moses and all who were with him;
But We drowned the others.

verses.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: Verily in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.
verses.transliteration: Inna fee thalika laayatan wamakana aktharuhum mu/mineen

verses.translation: And verily thy Lord is He, the Exalted in Might, Most Merciful.
And rehearse to them (something of) Abraham's story.

verses.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِۦ مَا تَعْبُدُونَ
verses.translation: Behold, he said to his father and his people: "What worship ye?"

verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ نَعْبُدُ أَصْنَامًا فَنَظَلُّ لَهَا عَـٰكِفِينَ
verses.translation: They said: "We worship idols, and we remain constantly in attendance on them."
He said: "Do they listen to you when ye call (on them)?"
"Or do you good or harm?"

verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ بَلْ وَجَدْنَآ ءَابَآءَنَا كَذَٰلِكَ يَفْعَلُونَ
verses.translation: They said: "Nay, but we found our fathers doing thus (what we do)."
He said: "Do ye then see whom ye have been worshipping,-
"Ye and your fathers before you?-

verses.arabic: فَإِنَّهُمْ عَدُوٌّ لِّىٓ إِلَّا رَبَّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
verses.translation: "For they are enemies to me; not so the Lord and Cherisher of the Worlds;
"Who created me, and it is He Who guides me;
"Who gives me food and drink,
"And when I am ill, it is He Who cures me;
"Who will cause me to die, and then to life (again);

verses.arabic: وَٱلَّذِىٓ أَطْمَعُ أَن يَغْفِرَ لِى خَطِيٓـَٔتِى يَوْمَ ٱلدِّينِ
verses.translation: "And who, I hope, will forgive me my faults on the day of Judgment.
verses.transliteration: Wallathee atmaAAu anyaghfira lee khatee-atee yawma addeen

verses.arabic: رَبِّ هَبْ لِى حُكْمًا وَأَلْحِقْنِى بِٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
verses.translation: "O my Lord! bestow wisdom on me, and join me with the righteous;

verses.arabic: وَٱجْعَل لِّى لِسَانَ صِدْقٍ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرِينَ
verses.translation: "Grant me honourable mention on the tongue of truth among the latest (generations);
"Make me one of the inheritors of the Garden of Bliss;

verses.arabic: وَٱغْفِرْ لِأَبِىٓ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ
verses.translation: "Forgive my father, for that he is among those astray;
"And let me not be in disgrace on the Day when (men) will be raised up;-

verses.arabic: يَوْمَ لَا يَنفَعُ مَالٌ وَلَا بَنُونَ
verses.translation: "The Day whereon neither wealth nor sons will avail,

verses.arabic: إِلَّا مَنْ أَتَى ٱللَّهَ بِقَلْبٍ سَلِيمٍ
verses.translation: "But only he (will prosper) that brings to Allah a sound heart;
"To the righteous, the Garden will be brought near,
"And to those straying in Evil, the Fire will be placed in full view;

verses.arabic: وَقِيلَ لَهُمْ أَيْنَ مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْبُدُونَ
verses.translation: "And it shall be said to them: 'Where are the (gods) ye worshipped-

verses.arabic: مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ هَلْ يَنصُرُونَكُمْ أَوْ يَنتَصِرُونَ
verses.translation: "'Besides Allah? Can they help you or help themselves?'
verses.transliteration: Min dooni Allahi hal yansuroonakumaw yantasiroon

verses.translation: "Then they will be thrown headlong into the (Fire),- they and those straying in Evil,
"And the whole hosts of Iblis together.
"They will say there in their mutual bickerings:

verses.arabic: تَٱللَّهِ إِن كُنَّا لَفِى ضَلَـٰلٍ مُّبِينٍ
verses.translation: "'By Allah, we were truly in an error manifest,
"'When we held you as equals with the Lord of the Worlds;
"'And our seducers were only those who were steeped in guilt.
"'Now, then, we have none to intercede (for us),
"'Nor a single friend to feel (for us).

verses.arabic: فَلَوْ أَنَّ لَنَا كَرَّةً فَنَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: "'Now if we only had a chance of return we shall truly be of those who believe!'"
verses.transliteration: Falaw anna lana karratan fanakoonamina almu/mineen

verses.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: Verily in this is a Sign but most of them do not believe.
verses.transliteration: Inna fee thalika laayatan wamakana aktharuhum mu/mineen

verses.translation: And verily thy Lord is He, the Exalted in Might, Most Merciful.
The people of Noah rejected the messengers.

verses.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ نُوحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.translation: Behold, their brother Noah said to them: "Will ye not fear (Allah)?
verses.transliteration: Ith qala lahum akhoohum noohunala tattaqoon

verses.translation: "I am to you a messenger worthy of all trust:
"So fear Allah, and obey me.

verses.arabic: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
verses.translation: "No reward do I ask of you for it: my reward is only from the Lord of the Worlds:
verses.transliteration: Wama as-alukum AAalayhi min ajrin inajriya illa AAala rabbi alAAalameen

verses.translation: "So fear Allah, and obey me."
They said: "Shall we believe in thee when it is the meanest that follow thee?"

verses.arabic: قَالَ وَمَا عِلْمِى بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.translation: He said: "And what do I know as to what they do?

verses.arabic: إِنْ حِسَابُهُمْ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّى ۖ لَوْ تَشْعُرُونَ
verses.translation: "Their account is only with my Lord, if ye could (but) understand.
verses.transliteration: In hisabuhum illa AAalarabbee law tashAAuroon

verses.translation: "I am not one to drive away those who believe.
"I am sent only to warn plainly in public."

verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ يَـٰنُوحُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْمَرْجُومِينَ
verses.translation: They said: "If thou desist not, O Noah! thou shalt be stoned (to death)."
verses.transliteration: Qaloo la-in lam tantahi yanoohu latakoonanna mina almarjoomeen

verses.translation: He said: "O my Lord! truly my people have rejected me.

verses.arabic: فَٱفْتَحْ بَيْنِى وَبَيْنَهُمْ فَتْحًا وَنَجِّنِى وَمَن مَّعِىَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: "Judge Thou, then, between me and them openly, and deliver me and those of the Believers who are with me."
verses.transliteration: Faftah baynee wabaynahum fathanwanajjinee waman maAAiya mina almu/mineen

verses.arabic: فَأَنجَيْنَـٰهُ وَمَن مَّعَهُۥ فِى ٱلْفُلْكِ ٱلْمَشْحُونِ
verses.translation: So We delivered him and those with him, in the Ark filled (with all creatures).
Thereafter We drowned those who remained behind.

verses.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: Verily in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.
verses.transliteration: Inna fee thalika laayatan wamakana aktharuhum mu/mineen

verses.translation: And verily thy Lord is He, the Exalted in Might, Most Merciful.
The 'Ad (people) rejected the messengers.

verses.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ هُودٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.translation: Behold, their brother Hud said to them: "Will ye not fear (Allah)?
verses.transliteration: Ith qala lahum akhoohumhoodun ala tattaqoon

verses.translation: "I am to you a messenger worthy of all trust:
"So fear Allah and obey me.

verses.arabic: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
verses.translation: "No reward do I ask of you for it: my reward is only from the Lord of the Worlds.
verses.transliteration: Wama as-alukum AAalayhi min ajrin inajriya illa AAala rabbi alAAalameen

verses.translation: "Do ye build a landmark on every high place to amuse yourselves?
"And do ye get for yourselves fine buildings in the hope of living therein (for ever)?
"And when ye exert your strong hand, do ye do it like men of absolute power?
"Now fear Allah, and obey me.
"Yea, fear Him Who has bestowed on you freely all that ye know.
"Freely has He bestowed on you cattle and sons,-
"And Gardens and Springs.

verses.arabic: إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
verses.translation: "Truly I fear for you the Penalty of a Great Day."

verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ سَوَآءٌ عَلَيْنَآ أَوَعَظْتَ أَمْ لَمْ تَكُن مِّنَ ٱلْوَٰعِظِينَ
verses.translation: They said: "It is the same to us whether thou admonish us or be not among (our) admonishers!
verses.transliteration: Qaloo sawaon AAalaynaawaAAathta am lam takun mina alwaAAitheen

verses.translation: "This is no other than a customary device of the ancients,
"And we are not the ones to receive Pains and Penalties!"

verses.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَهْلَكْنَـٰهُمْ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: So they rejected him, and We destroyed them. Verily in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.
verses.transliteration: Fakaththaboohu faahlaknahuminna fee thalika laayatan wama kanaaktharuhum mu/mineen

verses.translation: And verily thy Lord is He, the Exalted in Might, Most Merciful.
The Thamud (people) rejected the messengers.

verses.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ صَـٰلِحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.translation: Behold, their brother Salih said to them: "Will you not fear (Allah)?
verses.transliteration: Ith qala lahum akhoohum salihunala tattaqoon

verses.translation: "I am to you a messenger worthy of all trust.
"So fear Allah, and obey me.

verses.arabic: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
verses.translation: "No reward do I ask of you for it: my reward is only from the Lord of the Worlds.
verses.transliteration: Wama as-alukum AAalayhi min ajrin inajriya illa AAala rabbi alAAalameen

verses.translation: "Will ye be left secure, in (the enjoyment of) all that ye have here?-
"Gardens and Springs,
"And corn-fields and date-palms with spathes near breaking (with the weight of fruit)?
"And ye carve houses out of (rocky) mountains with great skill.
"But fear Allah and obey me;
"And follow not the bidding of those who are extravagant,-

verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُفْسِدُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا يُصْلِحُونَ
verses.translation: "Who make mischief in the land, and mend not (their ways)."
They said: "Thou art only one of those bewitched!

verses.arabic: مَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُنَا فَأْتِ بِـَٔايَةٍ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
verses.translation: "Thou art no more than a mortal like us: then bring us a Sign, if thou tellest the truth!"
verses.transliteration: Ma anta illa basharun mithlunafa/ti bi-ayatin in kunta mina assadiqeena

verses.arabic: قَالَ هَـٰذِهِۦ نَاقَةٌ لَّهَا شِرْبٌ وَلَكُمْ شِرْبُ يَوْمٍ مَّعْلُومٍ
verses.translation: He said: "Here is a she-camel: she has a right of watering, and ye have a right of watering, (severally) on a day appointed.
verses.transliteration: Qala hathihi naqatunlaha shirbun walakum shirbu yawmin maAAloom

verses.arabic: وَلَا تَمَسُّوهَا بِسُوٓءٍ فَيَأْخُذَكُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
verses.translation: "Touch her not with harm, lest the Penalty of a Great Day seize you."
verses.transliteration: Wala tamassooha bisoo-infaya/khuthakum AAathabu yawmin AAatheem

verses.translation: But they ham-strung her: then did they become full of regrets.

verses.arabic: فَأَخَذَهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: But the Penalty seized them. Verily in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.
verses.transliteration: Faakhathahumu alAAathabu innafee thalika laayatan wama kanaaktharuhum mu/mineen

verses.translation: And verily thy Lord is He, the Exalted in Might, Most Merciful.
The people of Lut rejected the messengers.

verses.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ لُوطٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.translation: Behold, their brother Lut said to them: "Will ye not fear (Allah)?
verses.transliteration: Ith qala lahum akhoohum lootunala tattaqoon

verses.translation: "I am to you a messenger worthy of all trust.
"So fear Allah and obey me.

verses.arabic: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
verses.translation: "No reward do I ask of you for it: my reward is only from the lord of the Worlds.
verses.transliteration: Wama as-alukum AAalayhi min ajrin inajriya illa AAala rabbi alAAalameen

verses.translation: "Of all the creatures in the world, will ye approach males,

verses.arabic: وَتَذَرُونَ مَا خَلَقَ لَكُمْ رَبُّكُم مِّنْ أَزْوَٰجِكُم ۚ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌ عَادُونَ
verses.translation: "And leave those whom Allah has created for you to be your mates? Nay, ye are a people transgressing (all limits)!"
verses.transliteration: Watatharoona ma khalaqa lakumrabbukum min azwajikum bal antum qawmun AAadoon

verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ يَـٰلُوطُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْمُخْرَجِينَ
verses.translation: They said: "If thou desist not, O Lut! thou wilt assuredly be cast out!"
verses.transliteration: Qaloo la-in lam tantahi yalootu latakoonanna mina almukhrajeen

verses.translation: He said: "I do detest your doings."
"O my Lord! deliver me and my family from such things as they do!"
So We delivered him and his family,- all
Except an old woman who lingered behind.
But the rest We destroyed utterly.

verses.arabic: وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِم مَّطَرًا ۖ فَسَآءَ مَطَرُ ٱلْمُنذَرِينَ
verses.translation: We rained down on them a shower (of brimstone): and evil was the shower on those who were admonished (but heeded not)!

verses.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: Verily in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.
verses.transliteration: Inna fee thalika laayatan wamakana aktharuhum mu/mineen

verses.translation: And verily thy Lord is He, the Exalted in Might Most Merciful.
The Companions of the Wood rejected the messengers.

verses.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ شُعَيْبٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.translation: Behold, Shu'aib said to them: "Will ye not fear (Allah)?
"I am to you a messenger worthy of all trust.
"So fear Allah and obey me.

verses.arabic: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
verses.translation: "No reward do I ask of you for it: my reward is only from the Lord of the Worlds.
verses.transliteration: Wama as-alukum AAalayhi min ajrin inajriya illa AAala rabbi alAAalameen

verses.arabic: ۞ أَوْفُوا۟ ٱلْكَيْلَ وَلَا تَكُونُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلْمُخْسِرِينَ
verses.translation: "Give just measure, and cause no loss (to others by fraud).
"And weigh with scales true and upright.

verses.arabic: وَلَا تَبْخَسُوا۟ ٱلنَّاسَ أَشْيَآءَهُمْ وَلَا تَعْثَوْا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مُفْسِدِينَ
verses.translation: "And withhold not things justly due to men, nor do evil in the land, working mischief.
verses.transliteration: Wala tabkhasoo annasaashyaahum wala taAAthaw fee al-ardimufsideen

verses.translation: "And fear Him Who created you and (who created) the generations before (you)"
They said: "Thou art only one of those bewitched!

verses.arabic: وَمَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُنَا وَإِن نَّظُنُّكَ لَمِنَ ٱلْكَـٰذِبِينَ
verses.translation: "Thou art no more than a mortal like us, and indeed we think thou art a liar!
verses.transliteration: Wama anta illa basharunmithluna wa-in nathunnuka lamina alkathibeen

verses.arabic: فَأَسْقِطْ عَلَيْنَا كِسَفًا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
verses.translation: "Now cause a piece of the sky to fall on us, if thou art truthful!"
verses.transliteration: Faasqit AAalayna kisafan minaassama-i in kunta mina assadiqeen

verses.translation: He said: "My Lord knows best what ye do."

verses.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَخَذَهُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمِ ٱلظُّلَّةِ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
verses.translation: But they rejected him. Then the punishment of a day of overshadowing gloom seized them, and that was the Penalty of a Great Day.
verses.transliteration: Fakaththaboohu faakhathahumAAathabu yawmi aththullati innahu kanaAAathaba yawmin AAatheem

verses.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: Verily in that is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.
verses.transliteration: Inna fee thalika laayatan wamakana aktharuhum mu/mineen

verses.translation: And verily thy Lord is He, the Exalted in Might, Most Merciful.
Verily this is a Revelation from the Lord of the Worlds:
With it came down the spirit of Faith and Truth-
To thy heart and mind, that thou mayest admonish.
In the perspicuous Arabic tongue.
Without doubt it is (announced) in the mystic Books of former peoples.

verses.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُمْ ءَايَةً أَن يَعْلَمَهُۥ عُلَمَـٰٓؤُا۟ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ
verses.translation: Is it not a Sign to them that the Learned of the Children of Israel knew it (as true)?
verses.transliteration: Awa lam yakun lahum ayatan anyaAAlamahu AAulamao banee isra-eel

verses.translation: Had We revealed it to any of the non-Arabs,

verses.arabic: فَقَرَأَهُۥ عَلَيْهِم مَّا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ مُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: And had he recited it to them, they would not have believed in it.
Thus have We caused it to enter the hearts of the sinners.

verses.arabic: لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِۦ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُا۟ ٱلْعَذَابَ ٱلْأَلِيمَ
verses.translation: They will not believe in it until they see the grievous Penalty;
verses.transliteration: La yu/minoona bihi hattayarawoo alAAathaba al-aleem

verses.translation: But the (Penalty) will come to them of a sudden, while they perceive it not;
Then they will say: "Shall we be respited?"
Do they then ask for Our Penalty to be hastened on?
Seest thou? If We do let them enjoy (this life) for a few years,
Yet there comes to them at length the (Punishment) which they were promised!

verses.arabic: مَآ أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يُمَتَّعُونَ
verses.translation: It will profit them not that they enjoyed (this life)!

verses.arabic: وَمَآ أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍ إِلَّا لَهَا مُنذِرُونَ
verses.translation: Never did We destroy a population, but had its warners -
verses.transliteration: Wama ahlakna min qaryatin illalaha munthiroon

verses.translation: By way of reminder; and We never are unjust.
No evil ones have brought down this (Revelation):
It would neither suit them nor would they be able (to produce it).
Indeed they have been removed far from even (a chance of) hearing it.

verses.arabic: فَلَا تَدْعُ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا ءَاخَرَ فَتَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُعَذَّبِينَ
verses.translation: So call not on any other god with Allah, or thou wilt be among those under the Penalty.
verses.transliteration: Fala tadAAu maAAa Allahi ilahanakhara fatakoona mina almuAAaththabeen

verses.translation: And admonish thy nearest kinsmen,

verses.arabic: وَٱخْفِضْ جَنَاحَكَ لِمَنِ ٱتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: And lower thy wing to the Believers who follow thee.

verses.arabic: فَإِنْ عَصَوْكَ فَقُلْ إِنِّى بَرِىٓءٌ مِّمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.translation: Then if they disobey thee, say: "I am free (of responsibility) for what ye do!"
verses.transliteration: Fa-in AAasawka faqul innee baree-onmimma taAAmaloon

verses.translation: And put thy trust on the Exalted in Might, the Merciful,-
Who seeth thee standing forth (in prayer),
And thy movements among those who prostrate themselves,
For it is He Who heareth and knoweth all things.

verses.arabic: هَلْ أُنَبِّئُكُمْ عَلَىٰ مَن تَنَزَّلُ ٱلشَّيَـٰطِينُ
verses.translation: Shall I inform you, (O people!), on whom it is that the evil ones descend?
They descend on every lying, wicked person,
(Into whose ears) they pour hearsay vanities, and most of them are liars.
And the Poets,- It is those straying in Evil, who follow them:

verses.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّهُمْ فِى كُلِّ وَادٍ يَهِيمُونَ
verses.translation: Seest thou not that they wander distracted in every valley?-
verses.transliteration: Alam tara annahum fee kulli wadinyaheemoon

verses.translation: And that they say what they practise not?-

verses.arabic: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ وَذَكَرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ كَثِيرًا وَٱنتَصَرُوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا ظُلِمُوا۟ ۗ وَسَيَعْلَمُ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوٓا۟ أَىَّ مُنقَلَبٍ يَنقَلِبُونَ
verses.translation: Except those who believe, work righteousness, engage much in the remembrance of Allah, and defend themselves only after they are unjustly attacked. And soon will the unjust assailants know what vicissitudes their affairs will take!
verses.transliteration: Illa allatheena amanoowaAAamiloo assalihati wathakaroo Allahakatheeran wantasaroo min baAAdi ma thulimoowasayaAAlamu allatheena thalamoo ayyamunqalabin yanqaliboon
